channel.title: Datviewer
channel.description:
Do someone have a working DatViewer? At most if Datviewers i get this error: [code]Put in your server folder Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: datViewer Press any key to continue. . .[/code] Well, its in the map for my server, and how about the real error?£
Thx for answers if you give, By Mod Mopar

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Mopar Mod Mopar
item.description:
@Mod_Mopar wrote:

Oke, but now, CAN SOMEONE HELP ME?? (us…) :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @pancholip pancholip
item.description:
@pancholip wrote:

yo! i get the same problem!!! i get the person’s thing and when i type in the person’s name again to save it, it does the same thing as yours, but i dont get the must be in server folder message. just move the datviewer folder into the folder where the server is.

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Mopar Mod Mopar
item.description:
@Mod_Mopar wrote:

Erm…This MUST be placed into your server folder Welcome to Dodian's Dat Viewer and Editor This utility allows you to edit playersaves It will only change what you tell it to, and should not corrupt files Commands: ->level ID LVL - sets the exp and level of the player to LVL (ex level 01 99 for 99 attack) ->save - saves the player Player Name: Bamoda Command: level 01 99 Player Name: save Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: PlayerSave at datViewer.main(Unknown Source) Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

Can you post a picture about how to do it?[br][size=1]Posted at: 31 August 2006, 09:01:20[/size][hr]Someone?

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

like this

type your name

then type “level 00 99” til you stop at “level 20 99”

then type “save”(hit enter)

close the batch

advice do it while user is logged out

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Mopar Mod Mopar
item.description:
@Mod_Mopar wrote:

But there automaticly ( or how do i typ ) comes “Player Name” after i set a lvl

This MUST be placed into your server folder Welcome to Dodian's Dat Viewer and Editor This utility allows you to edit playersaves It will only change what you tell it to, and should not corrupt files Commands: ->level ID LVL - sets the exp and level of the player to LVL (ex level 01 99 for 99 attack) ->save - saves the player Player Name: Bamoda Command: level 01 99 Player Name: level 02 99 Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: PlayerSave at datViewer.main(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue. . .[br][size=1]Posted at: 30 August 2006, 05:23:05[/size][hr]Can you post an example of how to do it, in a code?[br][size=1]Posted at: 30 August 2006, 05:25:17[/size][hr]?..

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @cook cook
item.description:
@cook wrote:

you dont need to write ur name after you say level 01 99
just say level 00 99 - level 20 99 then when ur done say save

Read full topic

item.title: Datviewer
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Mopar Mod Mopar
item.description:
@Mod_Mopar wrote:

What am i doing wrong?

This MUST be placed into your server folder Welcome to Dodian's Dat Viewer and Editor This utility allows you to edit playersaves It will only change what you tell it to, and should not corrupt files Commands: ->level ID LVL - sets the exp and level of the player to LVL (ex level 01 99 for 99 attack) ->save - saves the player Player Name: Bamoda Command: level 01 99 Player Name: Bamoda Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: PlayerSave at datViewer.main(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue. . .

Read full topic
